subclassFeature.name: Notable Champion
entries: The archetypal Champion focuses on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection. Those who model themselves on this archetype combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your weapon attacks reduce their critical range by one, for example they are critical on a 19 or 20, plus when you critically hit with a weapon attack you can regain an amount of health equal to 1d6 + your constitution modifier. You can regain life with this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Notable Fighting Style
entries: Fighting styles obtained from your fighter traits receive the following improvements:

items.name: Notable Archery
items.entry: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls you make with ranged weapons.

items.name: Notable Blind Fighting
items.entry: Blindsight increases to 15 ft. and you have advantage on wisdom (perception) checks that rely on hearing.

items.name: Notable Defense
items.entry: You gain +1 AC when you do not have a shield equipped.

items.name: Notable Dueling
items.entry: +1 to damage rolls, additionally, you can replace your opportunity attacks with the {@action shove} action.

items.name: Notable Great Weapon Fighting
items.entry: +1 to attack rolls with two-handed weapons.

items.name: Notable Interception
items.entry: Mitigated damage is calculated as 1d12 + (2 x proficiency).

items.name: Notable Protection
items.entry: Disadvantage is applied on all attacks against the protected target until the end of the attacker's turn. Alternatively, if the attacker is within 5 feet of you, you can impose disadvantage on all of his attacks that you are not the target of.

items.name: Notable Superior Technique
items.entry: You have one additional superiority die and both are 1d8

items.name: Notable Thrown Weapon Fighting
items.entry: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature no longer imposes disadvantage on your ranged weapon attacks, and you can pick up weapons within 5 feet as part of the attack.

items.name: Notable Two-Weapon Fighting
items.entry: +1 to damage rolls with dual weapon

items.name: Notable Unarmed Fighting
items.entry: Against a creature you have grappled, add your strength modifier to the damage roll you deal at the start of the turn and your unarmed strikes.

subclassFeature.name: Critical Versatility
entries: When landing a critical hit, you can apply one of the following effects depending on the base damage type of the weapon used:

items.name: Bludgeoning
entries: The attacked creature has disadvantage on saving throws and skill checks until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Slashing
entries: You can choose a number of creatures that are within range of your weapon equal to your proficiency, they also receive the effects of the attack plus slashing damage equal to your strength or dexterity modifier.

items.name: Piercing
entries: The attacked creature loses all movement and reactions until the start of your next turn.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all uses on a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Notable Fighting Style
entries: At 10th level, you can choose a second option from the Fighting Style class feature.

subclassFeature.name: Stay on Top
entries: When you score a critical hit with a weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice an additional time and add it as extra damage of the weapon's damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Critical
entries: Starting at 15th level, The critical range of your weapon attacks is reduced by 2.

subclassFeature.name: Comeback
entries: When using {@classFeature Indomitable|Fighter||9} you can keep any of the results. Additionally, your {@classFeature Second Wind|Fighter||1} feature increases his healing by 1d10.

subclassFeature.name: Survivor
entries: At 18th level, you attain the pinnacle of resilience in battle. At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 10 + your Constitution modifier if you have no more than half of your hit points left. You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points.

foundrySubclassFeature.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics}, if you already had proficiency you gain expertise.

You can add half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) on skill checks that rely on Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution and that do not already apply your proficiency. Additionally, thanks to your immaculate physical condition, you gain climbing and swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

foundrySubclassFeature.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your weapon attacks reduce their critical range by one, for example they are critical on a 19 or 20, plus when you critically hit with a weapon attack you can regain an amount of health equal to 1d6 + your constitution modifier. You can regain life with this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier per long rest.

foundrySubclassFeature.name: Superior Critical
entries: Starting at 15th level, The critical range of your weapon attacks is reduced by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Notable Archery
entries: You gain +1 bonus to damage rolls and +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Notable Blind Fighting
entries: You have {@sense blindsight} with a range of 15 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.
You also have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill perception}) checks that rely on hearing

optionalfeature.name: Notable Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC and while you don't have a shield equiped you gain another +1 AC.

optionalfeature.name: Notable Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon and you can replace any of your Opportunity Attacks with the {@skill Shove} action.

optionalfeature.name: Notable Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on any damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit and you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls you make with this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Notable Interception
entries: When a creature you can see hits a target other than you, within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by [[/r 1d12]] + two times your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a {@item shield|phb} or a simple or martial weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Notable Protection
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on all attack rolls against that target until the end of the attacker's turn. Alternately, if the creature that attacks a target other than you is within 5 feet of you, you can impose disadvantage on all of his attacks that you are not the target of. You must be wielding a shield to use this reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Notable Superior Technique
entries: You learn one {@filter maneuver|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B} of your choice from among those available to the {@class fighter|phb|Battle Master|Battle Master|phb|2-0 archetype}. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain two superiority dice, that are a d8 each (these dice are added to any superiority dice you have from another source). These dice are used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Notable Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property or pick a weapon if it is within 5 ft of you as part of the attack you make with the weapon, and when you hit with a ranged weapon attack using a thrown weapon you gain +2 bonus to the damage roll.
In addition, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Notable Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: You gain +1 damage when you attack with dual weapons. When you are holding Dual Weapons and can use your reaction to make an attack, you can make two attacks instead of one and these attacks must be against the same target.

optionalfeature.name: Notable Unarmed Fighting
entries: Your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier on a hit. If you aren't wielding any weapons or a shield when you make the attack roll, the d6 becomes a d8.

At the start of each of your turns, you can deal 1d4 + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage to one creature grappled by you and all your unarmed strikes against that creature add your Strength modifier to the damage.
